contentrichtext.text: '''NCAA Division III independents''' are four-year institutions that compete in [[college athletics]] at the [[National Collegiate Athletic Association|NCAA]]’s [[Division III (NCAA)|Division III]] level, but do so independently of an established [[List of college athletic conferences|athletic conference]]. These same institutions often compete as members of an intercollegiate athletic conference in some sports. The reason for independent status varies among institutions, but it is frequently because the primary athletic conference to which the institution belongs does not sponsor a particular sport. Independent programs for Division III: ==Football independents (as of March 2012)== {| class="sortable wikitable" style="text-align:center;" !Institution !Team !Location !Founded !Type !Enrollment !Primary Conference |- |[[Macalester College]] |[[Macalester Scots|Scots]] |[[Saint Paul, Minnesota]] |1874 |Private |2,005 |[[Minnesota Intercollegiate Athletic Conference|MIAC]] |- |[[Wesley College (Delaware)|Wesley College]] |[[Wesley Wolverines|Wolverines]] |[[Dover, Delaware]] |1873 |Private |2,320 |[[Capital Athletic Conference|CAC]] |} ==Basketball independents (as of July 2013)== {| class="sortable wikitable" style="text-align:center;" !Institution !Team !Location !Founded !Type !Enrollment !Football !Future Conference |- |[[University of California, Santa Cruz]] |[[UC Santa Cruz Banana Slugs|Banana Slugs]] |[[Santa Cruz, California]] |1965 |Public |15,825 |No | |- |[[Finlandia University]] |[[Finlandia Lions|Lions]] |[[Hancock, Michigan]] |1896 |Private |500 |No |[[Great South Athletic Conference|GSAC]]<sup>1</sup> |- |[[University of Maine at Presque Isle]]† |[[Maine–Presque Isle Owls|Owls]] |[[Presque Isle, Maine]] |1903 |Public |1,600 |No |[[Great South Athletic Conference|GSAC]]<sup>1</sup> |- |[[Mount Mary College]]^ |[[Mount Mary Blue Angels|Blue Angels]] |[[Milwaukee, Wisconsin]] |1913 |Private |1,929 |No | |- |[[Nebraska Wesleyan University]]† |[[Nebraska Wesleyan Prairie Wolves|Prairie Wolves]] |[[Lincoln, Nebraska]] |1887 |Private |2,100 |Yes | |- |[[College of New Rochelle]]^ |[[New Rochelle Blue Angels|Blue Angels]] |[[New Rochelle, New York]] |1904 |Private |6,800 |No | |- |[[Rust College]] |[[Rust Bearcats|Bearcats]] |[[Holly Springs, Mississippi]] |1866 |Private |1,200 |No | |- |[[St. Joseph's College (New York)|St. Joseph's College-Brooklyn Campus]] |[[St. Joseph's–Brooklyn Bears|Bears]] |[[Brooklyn, New York]] |1918 |Private |1,261 |No | |} ^ - Women's college<br> † - Schools holds dual membership with the [[National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics]] (NAIA).<br> <sup>1</sup> - Finlandia and Maine–Presque Isle (UMPI) are both co-educational colleges, but they will only be competing in the [[Great South Athletic Conference]] (GSAC) for women's sports, while the men's sports will still be competing as Independents, starting effectively in the 2013-14 season.<br> ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.d3independents.org/ The Association of Division III Independents] {{NCAA Division III football conference navbox}} [[Category:NCAA Division III]]
